result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J Fischer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs)], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 2-5 Yrs), Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT:  Pay al mandatory court costs, fees, surcharges including DNA & DV surcharges. To be paid  from 25% of prison funds. Balance paid during Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay results in a civil judgment. 
All nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges waived due to inability to pay.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, but consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications.

No violent contact with Beth F. or her minor children.
No contact with firearms or dangerous weapons.
No new law violations rising to probable cause.

Batterers Intervention Program.
Parenting classes.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample waived, previously provided.
Court advised due to DV conviction under Federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession; also advised  due to felony  conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, but consecutive to any other sentence.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (49 pages) PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING commencing 07-07-2015 received and filed.
Invoice forwarded to Account Payable in amount of $1,375.00 for Dr Robert Rawski for services on 04-01,02-2015, 05-05,08,11-2015 .Copy in file.

Defendant Brian J Fischer in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Brian J Fischer in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 55 MONTHS, concurrent to each count, but consecutive to any other sentence, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 15 MONHTS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 40 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 55 MONTHS, concurrent to each count, but consecutive to any other sentence, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 15 MONHTS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 40 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Batterers Intervention program.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with Beth F. or her minor children.
-Obtain/maintain employment or SSI/SSDI.
-No contact with firearms/or dangerous weapons.
-No new law violations rising to probable cause.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment. All NON-Mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.
- DNA Sample WAIVED, previously provided.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to DV conviction under federal law the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

AS TO COUNTS 1 & 2 AS AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Case passed to 1:30 PM.

Defendant Brian J Fischer in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Brian J Fischer in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Plea & Sentencing. 
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 1 Amended to Remove the Habitual Criminality Repeater, 939.62(1)(b).
AS TO COUNT 2
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on a motion of the state the court ordered Count 2 Amended to Remove the Habitual Criminality Repeater, 939.62(1)(b).
ORDER TO PRODUCE, TUESDAY JULY 07, 2015 AT 8:30 A.M. IN BR 23, CH RM 502. kl

Defendant Brian J Fischer in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Brian J Fischer in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Return of Doctor's Report. Court reviewed report, defendant found competent to proceed. Defense & State do NOT contest findings of the report. Court reinstated proceedings. Defense counsel requests a plea & sentencing date in branch 23. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Lette from Dr. Rawski to the court.
Received & Filed, Pyschiatric Evaluation.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Brian J Fischer not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Return of Doctor's Report. Defendant NOT produced. Court reviewed letter from Dr. Rawski, requesting additional time to complete Report. Case adjourned to allow Dr. Rawski additional time to complete evaluation and report for defendant. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Letter from Dr. Rawski.

Defendant Brian J Fischer in court with attorney Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Brian J Fischer in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Received and Filed, Amended Information. 

AMENDED INFORMATION reads:
Count 1: Battery, Domestic Abuse Repeater, Use of a dangerous weapon, habitual Criminality repeater, domestic abuse assessments, contrary to Wis Stats. 940.19(1), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), 939.63(1)(c), 939.62(1)(b), and 973.055(1).
Count 2: Disorderly conduct, domestic abuse repeater, use of a dangerous weapon, habitual repeater, domestic abuse assessments, contrary to Wis. Stats. 947.01(1), 939.51(3)(b), 939.621(1)(b) and (2), 939.63(1)(c), 939.62(1)(b), and 973.055(1).

Defendant given a copy of the amended information and advised of maximum penalties. Court reviewed the amended complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings. Defense entered a plea of guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court ordered Dr. Rawski be appointed to examine the defendant for NGI pursuant to Wisc. stats. 971.16. Court granted. Case adjourned in branch 23.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Louis Edward Epps in court, defendant Brian J Fischer not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Case set for Scheduling Conference. Case heard off the record. Parties request case be set for Arraignment. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Arraignment to branch 23.  Arraignment scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian J Fischer in court with attorney Francisco Araiza for Louis Edward Epps.  Defendant Brian J Fischer in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: BETH F OR ANY OF HER CHILDREN.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brian J Fischer in court with attorney Louis E. Epps.  
Defendant Brian J Fischer in custody.  
William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
